abstract: For now, at least, investors seem to believe that the United States has enough shock absorbers to comfortably withstand a default by Greece.
snippet: For now, at least, investors seem to believe that the United States has enough shock absorbers to comfortably withstand a default by Greece.
lead_paragraph: The tumult in the European monetary zone is spreading concern among investors of a broader crisis in financial markets from Ireland to Spain.

abstract: Faced with weak markets and uncertainty over regulations, many of the biggest firms are preparing for deep cuts in jobs and other costs.
snippet: Faced with weak markets and uncertainty over regulations, many of the biggest firms are preparing for deep cuts in jobs and other costs.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street plans to get smaller this summer. Faced with weak markets and uncertainty over regulations, many of the biggest firms are preparing for deep cuts in jobs and other costs.

headline.main: Wall Street Braces for New Layoffs as Profits Wane

abstract: The biggest names on Wall Street - Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America - are preparing for a round of cost cutting and layoffs. DealBook takes a look at why finance is cutting back.
snippet: The biggest names on Wall Street - Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America - are preparing for a round of cost cutting and layoffs. DealBook takes a look at why finance is cutting back.
lead_paragraph: The biggest names on Wall Street - Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America - are preparing for a round of cost cutting and layoffs. DealBook takes a look at why finance is cutting back.

abstract: The biggest names on Wall Street — Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America — are preparing for a round of cost-cutting and layoffs. DealBook’s Susanne Craig and Adrienne Carter discuss why Wall Street is cutting back and what it means for earnings and stock prices.
snippet: The biggest names on Wall Street — Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America — are preparing for a round of cost-cutting and layoffs. DealBook’s Susanne Craig and Adrienne Carter discuss why Wall Street is cutting back and what it means for e...
lead_paragraph: The biggest names on Wall Street — Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America — are preparing for a round of cost-cutting and layoffs. Goldman Sachs alone is planning to cut $1 billion from its noncompensation expenses over the next 12 months, roughly 10 percent of the total. DealBook’s Susanne Craig and Adrienne Carter discuss why Wall Street is cutting back and what it means for earnings and stock prices.

headline.main: Why Wall Street Is Cutting Back

byline.original: By Mac William Bishop, Susanne Craig and Adrienne Carter
